text: The Grammy Award for Best Country Solo Performance is an award presented at the Grammy Awards, a ceremony that was established in 1958 and originally called the Gramophone Awards. According to the 54th Grammy Awards description guide it is designed for solo (vocal or instrumental) country recordings and is limited to singles or tracks only. The award combines the previous categories for Best Female Country Vocal Performance, Best Male Country Vocal Performance and Best Country Instrumental Performance (if it is an instrumental solo performance). The restructuring of these categories was a result of the Recording Academy's wish to decrease the list of categories and awards and to eliminate the distinctions between male and female performances.Grammy Awards restructuring ==Recipients== ===2010s=== The first winner of the award is Taylor Swift for her song "Mean" in 2012 Carrie Underwood has the most wins (with Chris Stapleton) and the most nominations in this category Chris Stapleton is tied with Underwood for the most wins {| class="wikitable" width=75% |- bgcolor="#bebebe" ! width="10%" | Year ! width="45%" | Artist ! width="45%" | Work |- | rowspan="6" style="text"=align:center;
